pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce tRPC-Go framework, its purpose as a pluggable RPC framework, and high-level architectural concepts

pages.title: Features and Capabilities
pages.purpose: Detail tRPC-Go's key features including multi-protocol support, streaming, plugins, and extensibility

pages.title: Architecture and Design Principles
pages.purpose: Explain the layered architecture, plugin system, and core design principles like modularity and interface-based programming

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Guide users through initial setup and creating their first tRPC-Go service

pages.title: Installation and Dependencies
pages.purpose: Cover Go module setup, dependency management, and required tools like trpc-cmdline

pages.title: Quick Start Tutorial
pages.purpose: Walk through creating a simple service from Protocol Buffer definition to running server

pages.title: Understanding Generated Code
pages.purpose: Explain the code generation process, stub files, and how to implement service handlers

pages.title: Server Development
pages.purpose: Comprehensive guide to developing server-side services with tRPC-Go

pages.title: Service Types and Protocols
pages.purpose: Explain different service models: tRPC RPC, streaming, HTTP standard, RESTful, scheduled tasks, and consumers

pages.title: Server Configuration
pages.purpose: Detail trpc_go.yaml server section, service configuration, and trpc.NewServer initialization

pages.title: Service Registration and Naming
pages.purpose: Explain naming services, proto services, multi-service registration, and service discovery

pages.title: RESTful API Development
pages.purpose: Cover trpc.api.http annotations, HTTP rule mappings, transcoding, and customization points

pages.title: Streaming Services
pages.purpose: Guide for implementing server-side, client-side, and bidirectional streaming RPCs

pages.title: Client Development
pages.purpose: Guide to developing client applications that consume tRPC-Go services

pages.title: Client Interface and Proxies
pages.purpose: Explain client.Client interface, proxy generation, and making RPC calls

pages.title: Connection Management
pages.purpose: Detail connection modes: short connection, connection pool, and multiplexing

pages.title: Request Configuration and Options
pages.purpose: Cover client.Option functions, timeout configuration, metadata, and service discovery integration

pages.title: Error Handling
pages.purpose: Explain error codes, timeout handling, context cancellation, and error reporting

pages.title: Protocol and Codec System
pages.purpose: Deep dive into protocol encoding/decoding and the codec abstraction layer

pages.title: Codec Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain codec.Codec interface, codec registration, and the abstraction layer

pages.title: tRPC Binary Protocol
pages.purpose: Detail frame structure, RequestProtocol/ResponseProtocol, magic numbers, and version handling

pages.title: HTTP/RESTful Protocol
pages.purpose: Explain HTTP codec, header mapping, error handling, and RESTful transcoding

pages.title: Streaming Protocol
pages.purpose: Cover stream frame types (INIT, DATA, CLOSE, FEEDBACK) and streaming metadata

pages.title: Message Context (codec.Msg)
pages.purpose: Explain codec.Msg lifecycle, pooling, cloning, and service name parsing

pages.title: Serialization and Compression
pages.purpose: Detail serialization types (Protocol Buffers, JSON, Flatbuffers) and compression options

pages.title: Frame Headers and Structure
pages.purpose: Technical details of FrameHead binary layout, validation, and versioning

pages.title: Transport Layer
pages.purpose: Explain the transport abstraction and different transport implementations

pages.title: Transport Abstraction
pages.purpose: Explain transport.ClientTransport and transport.ServerTransport interfaces and registration

pages.title: HTTP Transport
pages.purpose: Detail HTTP server/client transport, TLS configuration, and net/http vs fasthttp
